message.content:
{"steps":[{"output":"[KR] 1) 조건 (가)에서 $\lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{f(x)+6}{e^x} = 1$이므로:
$\lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{ae^{2x}+be^x+c+6}{e^x} = 1$
$\lim_{x \to -\infty} (ae^x+b+\frac{c+6}{e^x}) = 1$
따라서 $b=1$, $c=-6$","explanation":"조건 (가)를 사용하여 $f(x)$의 계수 $b$와 $c$를 구합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 2) 조건 (나)에서 $f(\ln 2) = 0$이므로:
$a(2)^2 + 1(2) + (-6) = 0$
$4a + 2 - 6 = 0$
$4a = 4$
$a = 1$","explanation":"조건 (나)를 사용하여 $f(x)$의 계수 $a$를 구합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 3) 따라서 $f(x) = e^{2x} + e^x - 6$","explanation":"계수 $a$, $b$, $c$를 사용하여 $f(x)$를 완성합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 4) $f(x)$의 역함수 $g(x)$를 구하기 위해:
$y = e^{2x} + e^x - 6$
$y + 6 = e^{2x} + e^x$
$y + 6 = e^x(e^x + 1)$
$e^x = \frac{y+6}{e^x+1}$","explanation":"$f(x)$의 역함수를 구하기 위한 식을 정리합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 5) $\int_0^1 g(x)dx = p+q\ln 2$이므로:
$\int_0^1 \ln(\frac{x+6}{x+1})dx = p+q\ln 2$","explanation":"주어진 적분을 계산하기 위한 식을 설정합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 6) 적분 계산:
$\int_0^1 \ln(x+6)dx - \int_0^1 \ln(x+1)dx$
$= [(x+6)\ln(x+6)-x]_0^1 - [(x+1)\ln(x+1)-x]_0^1$
$= [7\ln7-1-6\ln6] - [2\ln2-1-\ln1]$
$= 7\ln7 - 6\ln6 - 2\ln2 + 1$","explanation":"적분을 계산하여 $p$와 $q$를 구합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 7) 따라서 $p = 1$, $q = 7\ln7 - 6\ln6 - 2\ln2 = 1$","explanation":"계산된 적분 결과를 통해 $p$와 $q$를 결정합니다."},{"output":"[KR] 8) $p + q = 1 + 1 = 2$","explanation":"$p$와 $q$의 합을 구합니다."},{"output":"[EN] 1) From condition (a), $\lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{f(x)+6}{e^x} = 1$:
$\lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{ae^{2x}+be^x+c+6}{e^x} = 1$
$\lim_{x \to -\infty} (ae^x+b+\frac{c+6}{e^x}) = 1$
Therefore, $b=1$, $c=-6$","explanation":"Using condition (a) to find the coefficients $b$ and $c$ of $f(x)$."},{"output":"[EN] 2) From condition (b), $f(\ln 2) = 0$:
$a(2)^2 + 1(2) + (-6) = 0$
$4a + 2 - 6 = 0$
$4a = 4$
$a = 1$","explanation":"Using condition (b) to find the coefficient $a$ of $f(x)$."},{"output":"[EN] 3) Thus, $f(x) = e^{2x} + e^x - 6$","explanation":"Using the coefficients $a$, $b$, and $c$ to complete $f(x)$."},{"output":"[EN] 4) To find the inverse function $g(x)$ of $f(x)$:
$y = e^{2x} + e^x - 6$
$y + 6 = e^{2x} + e^x$
$y + 6 = e^x(e^x + 1)$
$e^x = \frac{y+6}{e^x+1}$","explanation":"Rearranging the equation to find the inverse function of $f(x)$."},{"output":"[EN] 5) Since $\int_0^1 g(x)dx = p+q\ln 2$:
$\int_0^1 \ln(\frac{x+6}{x+1})dx = p+q\ln 2$","explanation":"Setting up the integral to calculate $p$ and $q$."},{"output":"[EN] 6) Calculate the integral:
$\int_0^1 \ln(x+6)dx - \int_0^1 \ln(x+1)dx$
$= [(x+6)\ln(x+6)-x]_0^1 - [(x+1)\ln(x+1)-x]_0^1$
$= [7\ln7-1-6\ln6] - [2\ln2-1-\ln1]$
$= 7\ln7 - 6\ln6 - 2\ln2 + 1$","explanation":"Calculating the integral to find $p$ and $q$."},{"output":"[EN] 7) Therefore, $p = 1$, $q = 7\ln7 - 6\ln6 - 2\ln2 = 1$","explanation":"Determining $p$ and $q$ from the calculated integral result."},{"output":"[EN] 8) $p + q = 1 + 1 = 2$","explanation":"Calculating the sum of $p$ and $q$."}],"final_answer":"\boxed{2}"}
